newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel-LS in standoff, HS available.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel-LS in standoff, HS available.

text.p: Low sulphur straight-run fuel continued to be an unpressured market on Wednesday. Dealers said sellers were relaxed and buyers showed no anxiety about picking up cargoes.
Prices gained with offers as high as the low $150s fob NWE, before drifting back to Tuesday's levels in the mid-$140s once crude came off.
"There's no incentive to buy in what many see as a softening market," said one dealer.

High sulphur straight-run was marginally busier with an M-100 cargo sold around $121 cif NWE, the price reflecting its high water content. The buyer was understood to be a utility that has already picked up cargoes in preference to cracked material. -- London +44 171 542 8980
